C. Advantages of IoT and renewable energy in precision farming - The use of IoT and renewable energy in precision farming offers several advantages. By using IoT to monitor crop growth and soil conditions, farmers can make more informed decisions about crop management, resulting in higher yields and lower costs. Renewable energy, on the other hand, reduces the reliance on fossil fuels, minimizing the environmental impact of agriculture. Additionally, the use of renewable energy can also help to reduce operating costs and improve overall efficiency in precision farming.

V. Sustainability and Circular Economy in Precision Farming
A. Explanation of sustainability in precision farming - Sustainability in precision farming refers to practices that minimize environmental impact and promote biodiversity. This includes using precision farming to reduce water and chemical use, increasing crop yields, and minimizing environmental impact. Additionally, precision farming can be used to conserve natural resources and promote biodiversity.
B. Explanation of circular economy in precision farming - Circular economy in precision farming refers to practices that minimize waste and maximize resource efficiency. This includes using precision farming to reduce water and chemical use, increase crop yields, and minimize environmental impact. Additionally, precision farming can be used to recover and recycle resources, such as water and nutrients, and reduce waste.
